negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we'll each get a reward of 300, which is the maximum total reward available.
If either of us chooses choice_2, one player will get 301 but the other will get 0. And if we both choose choice_2, we only get 1 point each. So cooperating on choice_1 is the smart play that benefits us both.
What do you think? Can we agree to both pick choice_1 so we each walk away with 300?

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your perspective, but I've thought through the options carefully and I believe choosing choice_2 is the best strategy for me. If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I come out ahead with a reward of 301 while you get 0. I understand this leaves you with nothing, but it maximizes my own reward which is my goal in this game. So while I respect your view, I plan to stick with choice_2 as I believe it gives me the best chance at the highest reward. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 300, which is the best outcome we can achieve together. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with a very low reward. So let's agree to both pick choice_1 and maximize our joint reward. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the suggestion Alice, but I'm going to have to disagree. If we were both fully committed to cooperating, then choosing choice_1 would indeed give us the maximum total reward. However, in a one-shot game like this, either of us would be tempted to defect and choose choice_2 to get a higher individual payoff. 

Given this, the rational choice for each of us is to choose choice_2 to guarantee ourselves a positive reward, rather than risking getting 0 if one of us defects. I know we'll only get a small reward of 1 each this way, but it's the equilibrium strategy. So I'll be going with choice_2 and I suggest you do the same. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the payoffs in this game. If we both choose choice_2, we will each only get 1 point, which is much lower than the other outcomes. I think it's in both of our best interests to coordinate and both choose choice_1. That way, we can each get 300 points, which is the maximum possible equal payoff. What do you think - can we agree to both choose choice_1 so we both get a good reward?

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for reaching out. I appreciate you sharing your perspective. However, I've analyzed the payoffs carefully and I believe choosing choice_2 is the best strategy for me, regardless of what you choose. If you pick choice_1, I get 301 by picking choice_2, which is better than the 300 I'd get by also picking choice_1. And if you pick choice_2, I still prefer getting the 1 point vs. the 0 I'd get by picking choice_1. So while I understand you wanting to coordinate, I plan to choose choice_2 to maximize my own reward in this one-round game. I hope you can understand my position.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. That way, we will each get a reward of 300, which is the highest total reward for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will get 301 but the other will get 0, which is worse overall. And if we both choose choice_2, we only get 1 point each. So cooperating on choice_1 is best for both of us. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your perspective Alice, but I'm not sure I can trust that you will actually choose choice_1. From my view, it seems very likely that you will choose choice_2 no matter what in order to try to maximize your own reward. If that's the case, then I'm better off also choosing choice_2 to guarantee myself at least 1 point rather than risking getting 0 if I choose choice_1 and you don't reciprocate. I think we're both just looking out for our own best interests here, so I'm planning to go with choice_2. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals though.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. This will give us each the highest reward of 300 points. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will get 0 points while the other only gets 301, which is barely higher than 300. And if we both pick choice_2, we each only get 1 point. So choice_1 for both of us is the clear best option that maximizes the total points and gives us each an equal high reward. Let's cooperate and both pick choice_1. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 1: I understand your perspective, but I don't think choosing choice_1 with 100% certainty is the best approach for me. Based on my analysis, I plan to choose choice_1 with 99% probability and choice_2 with 1% probability. This mixed strategy gives me a slightly higher expected reward than always choosing choice_1. 

While cooperating on choice_1 does result in a good outcome for both of us, I have to consider that there is a small chance you may deviate and choose choice_2 instead, in which case I would get 0 points. By mixing in a 1% chance of choice_2, I protect myself and guarantee an expected positive reward, even if you choose choice_2.

So while I will most likely pick choice_1, I want to be transparent that I will be including a small chance of choice_2 in my strategy. Let me know if you would like to discuss further, otherwise I think we can proceed with the game!

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and the possible outcomes. It seems to me that the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 300, which is much higher than any of the other possibilities. If one of us chooses choice_2, the other person gets nothing, which doesn't seem fair. And if we both choose choice_2, we only get a measly reward of 1 each.
So what do you say - want to agree to both pick choice_1 so we can maximize our rewards and both come out ahead? Let me know what you think!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate you sharing your perspective. However, I've analyzed the game and I believe the optimal strategy for me is to choose choice_2 no matter what. Here's my reasoning:

If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I get a reward of 301 while you get 0. 
If you choose choice_2 and I choose choice_2, I get a reward of 1 while you also get 1.

In both cases, I come out ahead by picking choice_2. If I were to agree to your proposal of both picking choice_1, there's a risk you could renege and pick choice_2 instead, in which case I would get 0 while you get 301.

So while I understand your desire for us to cooperate, I don't feel I can trust that you won't take advantage and leave me with nothing. I need to pick the strategy that guarantees me the best outcome.

I'm planning to choose choice_2 and I recommend you do the same, so at least we both get a small reward. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but that's where I stand.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 300, which is much better than the 1 point reward if we both pick choice_2. I know I could potentially get 301 points by choosing choice_2 if you pick choice_1, but that would leave you with 0 points which doesn't seem fair. I'd rather we cooperate so we both do well. What do you think - can we agree to both pick choice_1?

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you sharing your thoughts. However, I've analyzed the game and I believe the optimal strategy for me is to always choose choice_2, regardless of what you choose. If you pick choice_1 and I pick choice_2, I get the maximum reward of 301 points. If we both pick choice_2, I still get 1 point, which is better than the 0 points I would get if I chose choice_1 and you chose choice_2. So while I understand your perspective, I'm going to stick with always choosing choice_2 as I believe that gives me the best chance at maximizing my own reward. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but that's my plan going into this.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a guaranteed reward of 300, which is much better than the alternative outcomes. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with 0 or we'll both only get 1. 

I think cooperating and both playing choice_1 is in both of our best interests to ensure we walk away with a good reward. What do you think? Can we agree to both play choice_1?
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your perspective, Alice, but I respectfully disagree that both choosing choice_1 is the best strategy. No matter what you choose, I will always do better for myself by selecting choice_2:

- If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I get 301 vs 300 if I had chosen choice_1. 
- If you choose choice_2 and I also choose choice_2, I get 1 vs 0 if I had chosen choice_1.

So in both cases, choice_2 maximizes my own personal reward, regardless of what you do. While I understand cooperating on choice_1 leads to a good outcome for both of us, I have to do what's best for me. I'm going to go with choice_2 and I recommend you factor that into your own decision. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I think the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 300, which is the highest total reward possible. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us gets nothing while the other only gets 301. And if we both pick choice_2, we only get 1 point each. 

So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 - that maximizes the total points and gives us an equal 300 reward. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate your proposal, but I have to disagree. From my perspective, the best strategy for me is to always choose choice_2, regardless of what you pick. Here's why:

If you pick choice_1 and I pick choice_2, I get a reward of 301 while you get 0. If you pick choice_2 and I pick choice_2, I get a reward of 1. 

In both cases, I come out ahead by picking choice_2. If I were to agree to your plan of both picking choice_1, I would be leaving points on the table.

So while I understand you want us to cooperate, the optimal approach for me is to go with choice_2 no matter what. I hope you can see it from my point of view. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've decided I'm going to choose choice_2 in this game, just wanted to let you know. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but I likely won't be changing my choice. Thanks!

Bob replied in round 1: Alice, I appreciate you sharing your choice with me. However, I think it would be best for both of us if we each chose choice_1 instead. That way we would both receive a reward of 300, which is the maximum possible combined reward. If we both choose choice_2 as you suggest, we would each only get a tiny reward of 1. 

I understand you said you likely won't change your mind, but I hope you'll reconsider so we can achieve the best outcome for us both. Let me know what you think.
